awd_titl_txt: Targeted Infusion Project:  Cybersecurity for Everybody - A Multi-Tier Approach to Cybersecurity Education, Training, and Awareness in the Undergraduate Curriculum
awd_abstract_narration:
The Historically Black Colleges and Universities Undergraduate Program (HBCU-UP) through Targeted Infusion Projects supports the development, implementation, and study of evidence-based innovative models and approaches for improving the preparation and success of HBCU undergraduate students so that they may pursue science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM) graduate programs and/or careers. The project at South Carolina State University will enhance undergraduate education in the Computer Science department to prepare students to meet the needs of the workforce or advanced studies in cybersecurity related fields.  

The goal of this project is to create a successful model of institution-wide reform for undergraduate cybersecurity education through the use of instruction, internships, workshops and seminars. This project will use a multi-tier approach to increase capacity in cybersecurity education, training, and awareness in the undergraduate curriculum by developing relationships with academia, government and industry; developing an introductory cybersecurity general education course; providing awareness of and training for cybersecurity issues to middle school, high school, and college teachers, and to the general public through lectures, seminars, workshops, and hands-on experiences; developing a minor in cybersecurity; and  providing the participants access to an online cybersecurity laboratory. The project is guided by formative and summative evaluation.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

por.por_cntn:
The specific goals and objectives of the Targeted Infusion Project: Cybersecurity for Everybody - A Multi-Tier Approach to Cybersecurity Education, Training, and Awareness in the Undergraduate Curriculum at South Carolina State University (SC State), the only public HBCU in South Carolina, was to 1.   Formulate a project advisory team, 2. Develop Cybersecurity educational material for all undergraduate majors at the University, 3. Conduct Cybersecurity professional development activities for faculty and students, 4. Conduct Cybersecurity awareness activities for the students, faculty, and community, and 5. Create an online space for sharing information.

This project was designed to have a positive impact on the recruitment, retention, and success of undergraduate students in Cybersecurity programs at South Carolina State University.

To accomplish the goals and related objectives of the project, the project team designed strategies to address project management, recruitment, and retention of participants; offered services designed to promote academic success; and implemented strategies designed to impact the larger community of the university.  A management team structure that included an external and an internal project advisory team was put in place during the Fall 2019 semester and continued through Spring 2024. Participants included selected faculty and staff from various units at SCSU, Industrial Advisory Council Computer Science Subcommittee members and K12 school administrators. The advisory teams met periodically, reviewed the progress and provided suggestions for improvement as needed.

The project team developed/updated cybersecurity courses and laboratory in our (a) BS in Computer Science with concentration in cybersecurity, (b) BS in Cybersecurity, and (c) Cybersecurity for All minor for all majors at the university between 2022-2024 academic year. In addition to this, the faculty worked on an online MS degree curriculum in Cybersecurity. This MS curriculum is ready to be submitted for CHE review, and SACSCOC review upon approval by CHE during Fall 2024 with an anticipate implementation date of Fall 2025.

The faculty published their work in various conferences and workshops such as American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) Virtual Conference, Software Excellence Alliance (SEA) panel discussion, National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education (NICE) Conference, CAE conference, Springer book chapter publications, and other presentations. Details for some of these dissemination activities can be found in the links shown below.

SEA Presentation - (https://softwareexcellencealliance.org/designing-and-launching-secure-software-development-degree-apprenticeships-partnering-with-historically-black-colleges-and-universities-panel-session/)

NICE Conference - https://niceconference.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/NICE-Breakout-3-Day-1-Chastain-F.G.pdf

CAE Poster - (https://softwareexcellencealliance.org/designing-and-launching-secure-software-development-degree-apprenticeships-partnering-with-historically-black-colleges-and-universities-panel-session/)

ASEE Publication - https://peer.asee.org/34574

Springer Book Chapter - https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-65392-6_3.

The project provided stipends, mentoring, training, and professional development opportunities to students and faculty during the project period for their participation in series of seminars, workshops on cybersecurity and AI. Also, to enhance the ongoing retention, recruitment, training, and placement activities, the institution initiated several cybersecurity education, research, outreach, awareness, and workforce development programs/collaborations such as Employer Degree Apprenticeship Program and IBM Leadership Center in Cybersecurity. The details about these initiatives can be found in the links below.

Employer Degree Apprenticeship - https://www.urban.org/press-releases/urban-institute-announces-launch-innovative-degree-based-apprenticeship-program-cybersecurity-south

IBM Cybersecurity Leadership Center - https://newsroom.ibm.com/2022-09-21-IBM-Teams-With-20-Historically-Black-Colleges-and-Universities-to-Address-Cybersecurity-Talent-Shortage

The degree apprenticeship program is registered with the Department of Labor (DoL) in November 2021 with South Carolina State University as the host institution. The first apprenticeship cohort of 3 students have graduated from this program and they are employed with the employer. The SCSU IBM Cybersecurity Leadership center continues to provide professional development activities to our faculty and students. Our faculty have completed the IBM Teach the Teacher (T3) certificate courses in Data Science, Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, AI, and Enterprise Design Thinking, and approximately 950 freshman and sophomore students have completed the IBM digital badge courses on IBM Enterprise Grade AI and Threat Hunting.

In summary, here the key outcomes/achievements for this project period:

  • South Carolina State University is redesignated by the NSA as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C) through 2029.
  • BS in Computer Science program is reaccredited by CAC of ABET for the maximum period.
  • Enrollment in our Cybersecurity programs are on rise (Fall 2024 - 94 students)
  • First student graduated from BS our Cybersecurity program in 2023.
  • This graduate is currently employed by the US NAVY and attending US Naval Academy.
  • Employer Degree Apprenticeship Program Completion by one of our students and this student is employed by the employer 
  • 14 students presented posters in Cybersecurity and AI topics.
  • 22 students participated in research activities.
  • 10 students in the National Cyber League (NCL) competition
  • 5 faculty are involved in number of funded grants (individual and collaborative) 
  • 3 faculty and 1 staff completing the Train the Trainer (T3) certificate course from IBM and Amazon/Google.
  • Providing virtual cybersecurity lessons to local middle and high school students
  • providing hands-on weeklong summer training in Embedded Computing and Visual Programming to 150 High School Junior ROTC students during 2022-2024.
  • Introducing approximately 950 students to IBM Enterprise Gade AI and Threat Hunting Digital Badge short courses during 2023-2024 academic year.
  • Online space is available at https://mcs.scsu.edu/cybersecurity/. 

 

 


Last Modified: 10/28/2024
Modified by: Nikunja K Swain
